channel.title: Best desktop for a reasonable price?
channel.description:
Hey guys, my parents got my brother a laptop upon graduation, and they might be getting me a desktop; so I was wondering what a suitable brand would be, along with a reasonable price. Just wanting to know your thoughts on what the most reliable desktop would be. Links are appreciated!
- I have always used a laptop which is why I'm leery on my own. :|

item.title: Best desktop for a reasonable price?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

If you build your own, you can save quite a bit of money. If you spend $400 on a store-ready desktop, it will have decent specs. But if you build your own, you can do pretty good with $400. It’s not too hard to build one either, you can follow a YouTube tutorial, as I know there are many. Also, I’d recommend buying parts off Amazon/NewEgg, as they’re fairly cheap.

Read full topic
item.source: Best desktop for a reasonable price?

item.title: Best desktop for a reasonable price?
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

Build one yourself is the ideal thing to do, but if you really want a set up desktop then Dell warranties are pretty good. Their products are pretty average though

Read full topic
item.source: Best desktop for a reasonable price?

item.title: Best desktop for a reasonable price?
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:7, topic:477405”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=595598.msg4193678#msg4193678 date=1357191728]
Honestly, I would build it on my own, it honestly takes 2 or 3 hours to build
but if u seriously consider buying a prebuilt
cyberpowerpc andd ibuypower is probably the cheapest prebuilts you can find
[/quote]Exactly what I was going to say. These brands are great for their prices.[/quote]

Thanks guys, I’ll look these up. Also I just couldn’t imagine building a computer. I only do rsps stuff in my spare time as it is…

Read full topic
